physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The index patient was diagnosed with hyperthyroidism with undetectable TPO and TSHR antibodies aged 18 during her first pregnancy.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The fT4 levels increased to greater than 40.94 pmol/L after 2 years of treatment with thiamazole.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: TSH suppression was observed in the third child at the age of 8 years. He has not received antithyroid treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: All thiamazole-treated children show normal fT4 and fT3 values during the antithyroid drug treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The youngest boy exhibited TSH suppression already at 6 months and started thiamazole due to hyperthyroidism.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: His development is impaired due to being affected by epileptic encephalopathy after a herpes simplex stomatitis in infancy.
